intro: Ziziphora mussini, commonly known as Turkish hyssop, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Turkey and the Balkans. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a grayish-green hue. Its small, tubular flowers are usually blue to purple in color, arranged in whorled clusters along the stem. Ziziphora mussini is often found in rocky or dry habitats and is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
